page.title: 07Hatfield Broad Oak Today
page.content: { The village as seen in 1985. "Our village is very interesting and there is always a lot happening. Some of the houses are still thatched and one day when we went out for a walk we saw a house being rethatched. Around Hatfield Broad Oak are many public footpaths; it is enjoyable to walk beside Pincey Brook or Mus Brook listening to the ripple of the water over the gravel. One of the most interesting streets is called Cage End.The name is strange but it has a meaning. About 150 years ago there was a cage in this street in which people who had broken the law were kept. Cage End is very pretty and most of the houses are old, some dating back to Tudor times." Compiled from writing by two children, aged 10 and 11, who live in the village. See Photograph 'B'.
